channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road surface in full of holes and ridges, 20th September
item.description:
The road surface outside the bus stop Bryan Road/Surrey Docks Farm towards Victoria is in a very poor state of repair. There are potholes, dips and ridges and it's a patchwork of different materials.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin obstructing footpath, 20th September
item.description:
Please see the photo. This is a repeat occurrence. Can you please move the bin, or replace it with a harder-to-move metal one?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alma Road, Albany Park, London

item.title: Spillage of sand/stones, 20th September
item.description:

item.title: Thorny weed has regrown at base of tree, 20th September
item.description:
Could this weed be treated with a strong weed killer as your contractors were out only a few weeks ago cutting this back and it's regrow in that short time. Thankyou x

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in path, 20th September
item.description:
There is a growing pothole in the path that exits Russia Dock Woodland into Russia Walk, just south west of the cycle barrier. Due to the barrier and the number of users of this path it becomes congested and so hard to avoid the pothole. This is a danger to myself in my wheelchair as well as pedestrians, those on wheels and the cyclists using this route which is part of C14/Q4
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lady Dock Walk, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked cycle track, 20th September
item.description:
I am a 67 year old man who lives in bridge road, I only use a bycycle for transport since khans ulez made my car illegal to drive, the cycle track on the part of cray avenue I have indicated is constantly blocked by parked vehicles so is unusable and makes it dabgerous as I have to veer out into the fast traffic to get past them, if I cycle on the pavement I am abused and on one occasion attacked for doing so, please clear this cycle lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Cray Avenue, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic calming poles have been removed, 20th September
item.description:
The road laws in place to allow pedestrians to walk safely on the right hand side, from Footscray Road direction, are not being followed as the poles to restrict the traffic to a single lane have been removed. They have been placed in to nearby hedges, so it doesn't seem accidental. They need to be more permanently fixed in place or this will continue to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
